intro: Enneastemon schweinfurthii var. seretii, commonly known as the Seretii flame bamboo, is a striking ornamental plant native to southern China. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender culms covered in vibrant red or orange bracts that resemble flames. The plant typically grows to a height of 2–3 meters and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique foliage and colorful inflorescences make it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. It requires well-drained soil and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
